summary:
Hello, my name is Jan. I leverage my extensive medical knowledge to deliver long-lasting improvements to the quality of health care delivery systems and policies. 

The primary focus of my career to date has been international health infrastructure and policy development. Applying my unique combination of medical knowledge and project management abilities, I enhance public health care capacity and align the efforts of government agencies, private organizations, and NGOs. 

I take pride in having established evidence-based national and international health care strategies—my penchant for doing so stems directly from my ability to inform incisive research actions, decision-making, and policy development across complex organizations and coalitions.

Throughout my career, I have remained a staunch advocate for sexual and reproductive health services. My various contributions emphasize improved policies and services focusing on adolescent gender equality and combatting gender-based violence.

Could your team benefit from a skilled medical and public health professional who is passionate about improving medical systems and institutions? If so, please connect with me today!

profile_positions.description:
The principal role of the Adviser - Organizational Development is to support the capacity of the Instituto Nacional de Saúde (INS) to develop two key professional development packages for municipal and facility staff – the Integrated Suite of Development Programs (ISDP) and the Integrated Primary Heath Care Continuing Professional Development Approach. Furthermore the adviser will assist in the review and furthering of the Family Health concept within the government strategy of Saúde na Família. 
 
The ISDP aims to ensure that at each level, leaders and managers from any professional background share the same language, the same models, and the same understanding to lead and drive sustainable system change.
 
The Integrated PHC Continuing Professional Development approach aims to build the managerial, clinical and system readiness of Community Health Centers and Family Health Posts to provide quality facility, outreach services and accountability processes as per the Essential Services Package, including a people-centered life cycle approach culture aligned.

The adviser tasks are undertaken in a rapidly changing health sector environment, where the Ministry of Health is embarking on the acceleration of implementation of the National Health Sector Strategic Plan 2030 and INS is transformed into a full blown institute of public health (INSP-TL).
profile_positions.title: Adviser Organisational Development

profile_positions.description: SHINE Supply is a component of the Somali Health & Nutrition (SHINE) programme. SHINE aims to reduce mother and child deaths in Somalia and Somaliland by improving health and nutrition services. The SHINE Supply component focuses on delivering the Essential Package of Health Services (EPHS) and support for Health Systems Strengthening (HSS) SHINE Supply is led by Mott MacDonald and is implemented by four core consortium partners (CGA, IHE, IPA, THET) and three groups of NGO implementing partners (HPA, AAH, Mercy USA). This team has put in place a robust mechanism for reliably channeling resources and life-saving services to over 2.3 million of the poorest Somalis.
profile_positions.title: Consultant; Team Lead SHINE Supply Health and Nutrition Prgramme, Somalia-Somaliland
